channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mamdani Says Rivals Are Pushing Hate as Mayor’s Race Enters Last Stretch
item.description: Zohran Mamdani’s opponents, Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa, denied accusations that they are stoking Islamophobia with their rhetoric and actions.

item.title: Bannon Claims ‘There Is a Plan’ for Trump to Run for a Third Term
item.description: The claim comes after months of President Trump toying with the idea, insisting that he is “not joking” about defying a constitutionally-mandated term...

item.title: Sirikit, Glamorous Former Queen of Thailand Who Wielded Power, Dies at 93
item.description: As the wife of King Bhumibol Adulyadej, she traveled the world charming government leaders and the public.

item.title: Trump Administration Plans a Shake-Up at ICE to Speed Deportations
item.description: The preliminary plan stems from frustration over the pace of the deportations, which are lagging behind President Trump’s demands.

item.title: U.S. Details How Mob and Ex-NBA Players Lured High Rollers Into Poker Trap
item.description: A Manhattan apartment was at the center of a Mafia-run ring that used former N.B.A. players as bait and technology to read cards, prosecutors say.

item.title: Nebojsa Pavkovic, Yugoslav General Convicted of War Crimes, Dies at 79
item.description: Found guilty in 2009, he had been serving a 22-year sentence but was released for health reasons at the request of the Serbian government.

item.title: Sirikit, Glamorous Former Queen of Thailand Who Wielded Power, Dies at 93
item.description: As the wife of King Bhumibol Adulyadej, she traveled the world charming government leaders and the public.

item.title: U.S. Imposes Sanctions on Colombia’s Leader, One of President Trump’s Harshest Critics
item.description: The United States Treasury Department accused President Gustavo Petro of allowing drug trafficking to flourish.

item.title: Trump Leaves Behind a Reeling Washington to Chase a Deal With China
item.description: President Trump is embarking on a six-day diplomatic tour of Asia, testing his role as a statesman and negotiator as he pursues a trade deal with Beij...

item.title: U.S. Deploys Aircraft Carrier to Latin America as Drug Operation Expands
item.description: The Trump administration has acknowledged 10 strikes on suspected drug-smuggling boats from South America, which have killed 43 people.

item.title: Ontario quickly caves to Trump and promises to pull the offending Reagan ad that killed Canada trade talks
item.description: Days before he called the ad fraudulent, Trump told a group of Republican senators that he'd take out the same ad if he were Canadian.

item.title: Social Security payments to go up 2.8% next year while polls show three-fourths of seniors think 3% isn’t enough to keep up with rising prices
item.description: Recipients received a 2.5% cost-of-living boost in 2025 and a 3.2% increase in their benefits in 2024, after a historically large 8.7% benefit increas...

item.title: Stanford athlete turned wealth guru had everything he wanted by 30, but realized money doesn’t buy happiness: ‘I had the high-paying job, the title, the house, the car’
item.description: “The 5 Types of Wealth” author Sahil Bloom had all the trappings of success—but he quickly realized that money doesn’t buy happiness.

item.title: Billionaire ex–Google CEO says one deceptively simple weekend habit will help you level up at work
item.description: It’s an approach he learned from his mentor, Silicon Valley legend Bill Campbell.

item.title: Pentagon orders aircraft carrier to Latin America, boosting U.S. military buildup in the region to more than 10,000 sailors and Marines
item.description: The USS Gerald R. Ford, which has five destroyers in its strike group, is now deployed to the Mediterranean Sea.
